header.title: Grammar school bans teachers calling pupils 'girls' to not offend transgender children
header.subtitle: TEACHERS at a leading all-female school have been ordered not to refer to its pupils as girls.
header.postText: 'The ban is said to be to avoid upsetting youngsters who are questioning their gender.', 'And it comes despite the word featuring in the single-sex school’s name: Altrincham Grammar School for Girls.', 'The school, in Trafford, Greater Manchester, confirmed that the term will no longer be encouraged when staff address the pupils.', 'Principal Stephanie Gill said she wants to break what she describes as ingrained habits in the way pupils are spoken to and spoken about.', 'She wrote to parents: “We have moved to using gender neutral language in all our communications with students and parents.', 'We know that for many transgender students being misgendered can be very hurtful. ', 'The school, which first opened its doors in 1910, educates 1, 350 girls and was recently lauded as the best in the North - west of England.', 'All of its students were awarded A * -C grades in last year’ s GCSE exams and it is the largest single - sex grammar school in England.', 'One parent, who asked not to be named, said: When I opened the letter I wasn’ t sure if it was a joke or not. ', 'We are not even sure how many girls there are having issues with their gender, it could be there’ s none.', 'It all seems a bit potty to me, they are talking about diversity but it’ s a girls - only school.How does that work ? ', 'Another adult said outside the school : I think we live in an age where we have to respect everyone’ s views, and if they have an issue around their gender we have to understand that.', 'However, I may be old - fashioned but I think girls should be referred to as girls and boys should be referred to as boys.', 'The letter went out to parents just before Christmas and adds: We are conscious of recent figures which show that more than four in five trans young people have self - harmed and more than two in five have attempted to take their own life. ', 'Everyone’ s welcome here.Staff have embraced these changes and are doing their best to implement the new policy. ', 'Former children’ s mental health tsar Natasha Devon applauded the school.', 'She said: In order to be inclusive of everyone you just need to say ‘hello everyone’, instead of girls or boys– it’ s not a massive leap to make.', 'You always get this ‘PC gone mad’ argument whenever a new idea comes into the public sphere.I fully expect that in 10 years’ time this will just be something that everybody does.', 'A statement issued by Altrincham Grammar said: It’ s important our students feel comfortable and able to bring their true selves to the learning environment. ', 'We welcome and celebrate diversity at our school and we will look at any measure, however small, to ensure the wellbeing of our staff and students.', 'Four years ago the school, motto Fortiter, Fideliter, Felicite (Bravely, Faithfully, Cheerfully), found itself in the middle of a sexism row after a society started by pupils took part in a national campaign.', 'The campaign, titled Who needs feminism ?,saw pupils post photographs of themselves holding placards expressing their views online.', 'Management at the school demanded pupils’ photos be removed after what one student described as a torrent of degrading and explicitly sexual comments.'

commentThread.commentText: Absolutely RIDICULOUS - and dangerous.Young people growing up have enough to contend with and manage without the subject of questioning gender being flagged up in their faces. if an individual is having transgender questions and issues they can be sympathetically listened to and supported without making it an issue for the whole school - and their pupils ' families and the community. Totally irresponsible and dangerous for the vast majority NOT havin g transgender issues.

This madness is easily solved as it works both ways. A transgender pupil if there is one may be offended at being referred to as a girl, but the girls who are not transgender should be offended at thei r gender identity being taken away from them. The school is ignoring the ir gender apart from in the name of the school...doh. Time for parents to grow a pair and speak out very loudly.

commentThread.commentText: The former Professor of Psychiatry at John Hopkins Hospital Paul Mc Hugh along with a preponderence of many other leading psychiatrists and psychiatric institutions believe that so called transgender is a mental illness to be treated as such. Nearly four decades after he derailed a pioneerin g transgender program at Johns Hopkins Hospital with his views on “guilt-ridd en homosexual men,” psychiatrist Paul McHugh is seeing his institution come full circle with the resumption of gender-reassignment surgeries. McHugh, the hospital’ s chief of psychiatry from 1975 to 2001, still believes that be ing transgender is largely a psychological problem, not a biological phenomenon '. Health & Science April 2017. It would appear that the principle of this school is also in need of treatment.And the girls need protection from her madness.
Lunatics taking over the Asylum, used to be a joke. Not any more.

commentThread.commentText: And this silly women is in charge of our young people? Help and understanding should be available for anyone suffering concerns about their sexuality BUT do not make the rest of society fall in line with a minority portion of the population. That just breeds resentment and will not help those that need the help.

Absolutely ridiculous but that is only a part of the story. My daughters are GIRLS and my son is a BOY and no school has the right to challenge that. I would sack the head teacher and any member of the teaching staff that supported this trans-gender rubbish. All the parents should not only complain but should also insist that the teachers are seriously reprimanded.

Um? It's an all girls school. Let's try a bit of logic. A boy transitioning to a girl would have to be recognised as a girl before being allowed in, and would presumably be only too happy to be called a girl. A girl transitioning to a boy presumably would either not bother to apply or would have to leave if the process began during 'his' stay there. So how in the world can referring to the girls, at an all girls school, as girls, be offensive to any of them ?

The fault is with those who tolerate this ridiculous charade.  A vociferous, mentally disturbed minority are being encouraged to impose their will on the majority, thus making deviance the norm. In whatever perverse form some may wish to name or sexually identify themselves is up to them, but likewise others are free not to accept it. The ultimate objective of those promoting this destructive agenda is to undermine and then change traditional societal values. So they target the most vulnerable group open to ideological manipulation: Young people. Every totalitarian group, whether it be political or religious, always focuses on the young.
Imagine the Queen launching a ship. I Name This Ship IT MS Tragedy, Bless IT and All Who Sail with IT

Surely if a child at an all-girls school has gender doubts, the child should be forced to leave?
And the human race.

I fully expect that in 10 years’ time this will just be something that everybody does. I fully expect it to be a criminal offence to address someone as Mr or Mrs, girl or boy and him or her well before then. These criminals will be pursued vigorously,  and their heinous crimes punished to the full extent of the law.A custodial sentence will almost certainly be passed down.

Children are either girls or boys. A minuscule minority have an issue with how they are categorised, but they need to be told to get over it in terms of the words used to address them. Teachers, and others, will simply address them based on how they look, the clothes they are wearing, their hair etc and make a judgement on that basis. And I say that as someone who has a " gender neutral" title.
